text.text_translated:
Gary Collins is a policeman. One day, he was not working. He was at home watching TV. He saw news about riots in London.

Gary knew some of the people on the TV. He was on holiday, but he stopped his holiday early. He wanted to help the other police. He helped them find the names of the people.

For six months, he watched camera videos. He found and named 190 people. Sometimes, he only saw their eyes. His help was very, very important.

The police had 200,000 hours of video. They used a computer program to find faces. But the computer only found one person.

best_attempt.text_translated:
Gary Collins is a policeman. One day, he was not working. He was at home watching TV. He saw news about riots in London. A riot is when angry people break things in the street.

Gary knew some of the people on the TV. He was on holiday, but he stopped his holiday early. He wanted to help the other police. He helped them find the names of the people.

For six months, he watched security camera videos. He found and named 190 people. Sometimes, he only saw their eyes. His help was very, very important.

The police had 200,000 hours of video. A computer program also looked at the videos. But the computer only found one person.
